abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes number of parking tickets being issued in New York City has fallen drastically in two weeks following murders of police officers in Brooklyn; submits reduction has been blamed on clash between Mayor Bill de Blasio and police officers, but fact that police and ticket agents have not had new contract since 2010 may also be factor.
lead_paragraph: To some, an apparent police slowdown is linked to the clash between officers and Mayor Bill de Blasio. But perhaps something else is at work: Neither the ticket agents nor the officers have had a new contract since 2010.
snippet: To some, an apparent police slowdown is linked to the clash between officers and Mayor Bill de Blasio. But perhaps something else is at work: Neither the ticket agents nor the officers have had a new contract since 2010.

headline.main: Ticket Falloff, 2 Officers’ Deaths and Overdue Contracts
headline.print_headline: Ticket Falloff, 2 Officers’ Deaths and Overdue Contracts
